text: Kathryn Stripling Byer (November 25, 1944 – June 5, 2017), also called Kay Byer, was an American poet and teacher. She was named by Governor Mike Easley as the fifth North Carolina Poet Laureate, 2005–2009. She was the first woman to hold the position. Byer died at the age of 72 on June 5, 2017 from lymphoma in Cullowhee, North Carolina. == Related pages == *List of poets from North America ==References== ==Other websites== * * Here Where I Am Blog Category:1944 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from lymphoma Category:Cancer deaths in North Carolina Category:American poets Category:Educators from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Writers from North Carolina Category:Writers from Georgia (U.S. state) Category:Educators from North Carolina
title: Kathryn Stripling Byer
